snippet: A conservative message threaded with a contrarian strain of libertarianism is perhaps the most unconventional route to assembling a winning coalition.
abstract: Sen Rand Paul of Kentucky announces his candidacy in 2016 presidential race; offers conservative message in speech that also contains contrarian strain of libertarianism he hopes will appeal to broader coalition some believe will be necessary to win; speech underscores worries in Republican camp that party is not inclusive enough to win presidency; many Republicans doubt Paul success given his unorthodox position on several issues, such as drug laws and defense.
lead_paragraph: A conservative message threaded with a contrarian strain of libertarianism is perhaps the most unconventional route to assembling a winning coalition.

headline.main: Rand Paul Taking an Untested Route to the Republican Nomination
headline.print_headline: Paul Is Taking Untested Route to Nomination
